trans-unit.source: Import failed
Import successful! Imported %imported users and updated %updated users out of total %total valid users found in LDAP
Pruning failed
Pruning successful! %deleted users deleted

Use this page to set up the connection details for your LDAP or Active Directory server. It is highly recommended that you read the online help before use, as misconfiguration may prevent you from accessing configuration pages to rectify issues.
View the online documentation
LDAP support is not installed
The PHP LDAP extension is required to use this functionality. As this module is not installed, all functionality on this page has been disabled.
Important information

When you enable LDAP as your authentication backend in Authentication configuration, you will lose access to all accounts which do not also exist in the LDAP database. This may mean you lose administrative access.

To resolve this issue, either import all users using the tool on this page and make one an administrator using Users configuration, or create a user with the same username as one in LDAP and make that one an administrator.
Connection details
LDAP connection URI

URI used for connecting to the LDAP server. Format is <schema://[name[:port]]/>, where schema is one of: ldap (plain-text), ldaps (TLS connection), or ldapi (UNIX domain socket). For example: ldap://hostname/, ldap://hostname:1389/, ldaps://hostname:636/, ldaps://hostname:1636/, ldapi:///.
Base DN
Base DN under which all user and group entires can be found. For example: dc=ldap,c=example,dc=com.
Control user DN

LDAP distinguished name (DN) for control user. Control user needs to be able to access all relevant user and allowed group entries in the LDAP directory. Read-only access is sufficient. The user does not need to be able to read any credentials (passwords). To use anonymous bind for control user, leave the setting blank. For example: cn=tbg,ou=services,c=example,dc=com.
Control user password
Password for logging in into LDAP directory using the control user DN. To use anonymous bind for control user, leave the setting blank.
Use HTTP Integrated Authentication

Enable automated login by using username passed-in into application via HTTP header. This requires that the web server performs authentication on behalf of The Bug Genie (e.g. HTTP Basic Authentication, Kerberos etc).
HTTP header field
HTTP header field containing the username if HTTP Integrated Authentication is enabled. For example: REMOTE_USER.
Object DN attribute
LDAP attribute that contains the distinguished name of an object. On most LDAP servers this shouild be set to entrydn. If using Active Directory, set the value to distinguishedName.
User object class
Object class used for locating valid user entries. For example: person, inetOrgPerson.
User username attribute
LDAP attribute where the username is stored. For example: uid.
User full name attribute
LDAP attribute where the full name of the user is stored. If not specified, cn will be used if available. For example: displayName.
User buddy name attribute
LDAP attribute where the buddy name is stored. For example: gn.
User e-mail address attribute
LDAP attribute where the e-mail is stored. For example: mail.
Allowed groups

Comma-separated list of allowed groups. Each group should be specified by its common name (cn) attribute. If specified, only users that are members of these groups will be able to access The Bug Genie. Leave this option blank to disable group membership checks and allow any valid LDAP user to access The Bug Genie. For example: tbg,mygroup1,mygroup2.
Group object class
Object class used for locating valid allowed group entries. For example: groupOfNames, groupOfUniqueNames.
Group member attribute
LDAP attribute in allowed group entries where member users are stored. For example: member, uniqueMember.
Click "%save" to save the settings
Save
Test connection

After configuring and saving your connection settings, you should test your connection to the LDAP server. This test does not check whether the DN and attributes can allow The Bug Genie to correctly find users, but it will give an indication if The Bug Genie can talk to your LDAP server, and if any groups you specify exist. If HTTP integrated authentication is enabled, this will also test that your web server is providing the configured header.
Import all users

You can import all users who can log in from LDAP into The Bug Genie with this tool. This will not let them log in without switching to LDAP Authentication. We recomemnd you do this before switching over, and make at least one of the new users an administrator. Already existing users with the same username will be updated.
Import users
Prune users

To remove the data from The Bug Genie of users who can no longer log in via LDAP, run this tool. These users would not be able to log in anyway, but it will keep your user list clean. The guest user is not affected, but it may affect your current user - if this is deleted you will be logged out.
LDAP connection URI must be specified.
Base DN must be specified.
Object DN attribute must be specified.
User object class must be specified.
User username attribute must be specified.
Both group object class and group member attribute must be specified if allowed groups are provided.
HTTP header field must be specified if HTTP Integrated Authentication is enabled.
LDAP connection URL has invalid syntax.
Failed to bind as control user. Error was: %error
LDAP search failed. Filter: %filter; Error: %error
Failed to validate groups (groups do not exist or multiple entries were found): %groups
Failed to locate any valid users in LDAP directory.
HTTP integrated authentication is enabled but the %headerfield header is not being provided to The Bug Genie. Please check your web server configuration.
Failed to locate current user (%username) in LDAP directory. If you enable LDAP authentication, you may find yourself locked-out of the settings. All other checks have passed.
LDAP connection test failed
Connection test successful
All LDAP connection tests have passed.
LDAP module has not been configured correctly. Please check your settings and test connection.
HTTP integrated authentication is enabled but the HTTP header has not been provided by the web server.
This user was found multiple times in the directory, please contact your administrator
HTTP authentication internal error.
